description:
The task cards show color combinations, and your objective is to recreate these by placing wooden blocks in these colors on the gameboard. The white joker is very helpful for that. On each turn, you may either blindly draw a block out of the bag or relocate a block that is already on the board.

Playing this game fosters spatial vision in combination with concentration – and with fun.
The first player to fulfill the 8 task cards wins.

It seems to be a lightwEIGHT game – but both players need to stay alert, since a good chance of completing a task can be blocked quickly.

As a concept, gladiatorial combat is one of the more horrible ideas that humans have come up with. However, it certainly has a morbid and primal appeal. Even the Saintly Augustine of Hippo observed how quickly one could become drunk on the sights, sounds, and bloodshed of the Roman Games.

Munus is a set of rules designed to stage a miniature recreation of gladiatorial combat. 
The core rules are intended to be streamlined so that two players, with a sound understanding of the rules, can string several half-hour games together in a single game session.

—description from the publisher

Atlantic Sentinels is a solitaire, tactical level game placing you as the Senior Officer of the Escort, shepherding a convoy in the North Atlantic from the attacks of U-boats, both singly and in wolfpacks. You are in command of a convoy escort group, composed typically of 4-10 escort vessels guarding a convoy on its way across the Atlantic.  Your mission is to protect as much Allied shipping as possible while simultaneously destroying as many U-boats as possible during the height of the U-boat threat – 1942 to early 1943.

Atlantic Sentinels provides players with a host of decisions as he is assigned to protect merchant convoys, typically ranging from 40 to 60 ships. The placement of escorts to offer front, rear, and flank protection to the convoy is complicated by the size of the convoy and available assets. Additional decisions must be made on where to place the escorts, which are equipped with Type 271 radars, the key to your defense.

As the game progresses, a player’s Escort Group may receive upgrades in the form of additional radars, HF/DF (High-Frequency Direction Finding) equipment, and possibly additional ships. Air support can be key, but until the CVE “jeep carriers” arrive, the “Black Pit” in the center of the Atlantic remains a high threat area. Players will find it highly challenging to minimize convoy losses and keep them to an acceptable level.

Players may choose any of 9 historical Escort Groups (five British, four Canadian) armed with historical destroyers and corvettes. The game is designed to integrate with The Hunters if players wish to combine the games.

Product Information:
Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 10 out of 10 (solitaire game design)
Time Scale: Semi-abstract (Convoy escort missions, 2 per month)
Map Scale: Abstract
Unit Scale: Individual escorts, U-boats, merchant ships (when targeted)
Players: One (with option for two)
Playing Time: 15 to 20 minutes (single mission), 6-8 hours (full career)

—description from the publisher

Transform into a dandelion, and float through clear blue skies on a pleasant breeze in this dice-rolling, area-majority game with a little direct-competition edge. Your quest is to find the best spots for your seeds to grow across a variety of vibrant, beautiful, and cozy gardens.

In Dandelions, players roll a group of dice, then choose one to move to a beautiful garden. Along the way, you can harness the power of the wind with three special actions — float, puff, and gust — to get the most points. The game ends after all the dice are used, and whoever receives the most victory points as combined from two different scoring methods wins.

Africa is the cradle of civilization and home to the greatest kingdoms in the world. Throughout various periods of history, empires rise and fall. Kingdoms come and go. But only the most victorious are remembered! You are a leader of a mighty African kingdom. Lead your kingdom to supremacy through your prowess in tactical movement, the market, kingdom management, and military might. However, rival kingdoms threaten your reign. To make matters worse, there are monsters invading from the Realm! But if you are mighty enough to defeat a monster, then you can capture it and use it in future battles. History is in the making! Time is short. There are multiple paths to victory but only one kingdom may be victorious. How will your kingdom be remembered?

The goal of Kingdom Come is to have the most victorious kingdom in Africa! You will lead your kingdom to victory by set collection and accumulating victory points over the course of 3 periods. During each period, you will position your military across Africa, go to the market to buy upgrades, manage your kingdom, and engage in epic battles against monsters and other players' kingdoms. The player with the most victory points at the end of all periods wins the game!

Kingdom Come is a celebration of the history, diversity, and cultures of Africa. It is driven by ubuntu philosophy and features a strong emphasis on empathic user-centered design. Thus, in Kingdom Come, you will feel welcomed, victorious, and motivated to win to the very end.

—description from the designer

Catch Sketch is a speed drawing game. You have to draw images to explain a keyword as quick as possible. The active player will guess the keyword by looking at the images of the fastest player. But, if he makes a wrong guess, the chance to get a score will passed to the next fastest player. So be quick, but draw recognizable images to win.

—description from the publisher

Business is booming for local artisans and as assistants at the local paint shop, you and your opponent must race to meet their urgent requests! Carefully manage your inventory of colors, invest at the right time to obtain useful bonuses and abilities, and assemble sets to fulfill the requirements for rare and valuable color swatches.

Chromatics is a tight, two-player strategy game about colors. In a fresh twist on established game mechanics, each player's resources - red, blue, and yellow "primary color cubes" - also function as the "workers" used to secure positions around a contested 4x4 grid of cards. Each round, players place cubes from their inventory on various border cards, before deciding to take one of two actions:


     investing cubes, allowing players to build up their supply of colors, or
     spending cubes, obtaining a wide variety of action cards featuring inventive abilities and lucrative scoring bonuses


When each round ends, players are also provided an opportunity to purchase vibrant paint swatches, further adding to their score - but depleting their inventory of resources at the same time. At the end of the game, players tally their scores. Most points is the winner!

Featuring an approachable art style, a creative blend of mechanics familiar to veteran players, and a variety of cards to ensure no two games are alike, Chromatics is an exciting entry into the genre of two-player strategy games. Who knew colors could be so competitive?

—description from the designer

The Brotherhood of the Red Cloth long made their home deep in the abandoned mines of the Black Mountains. But sickness came upon them as they delved too deep, and their minds have been twisted and their attention has shifted to creating wicked evils. Darkness now lives here and only a true hero can cure the madness that has consumed all... Are you that hero?

Tin Helm is the little brother to the hit solo dungeon crawler Iron Helm. Tin Helm shares some mechanics with it's older brother, but applies many new twists. Tin Helm also is quite small in size and makes the perfect dungeon-on-the-go game. It literally fits in a shirt pocket.

Fragmentz is recreation of fast-paced Korean poker/card game called Go-Stop. With the Fragmentz deck players can play two types of games which are Go-Stop and Gree.

Go-Stop, The goal of Go-Stop is to capture cards from a central layout by playing a card of the same realm(landscape). The aim is to collect scoring combinations among the cards captured. When a player's captures have a sufficient value, the player can 'stop' the game and claim payment, or can continue the game ('go') taking the risk with hope of winning more.

Gree, is a new interpretation of Korean version of Texas Hold'em called 'Seotda', playing with 20 cards from the deck and each players dealt 2 cards(or 3 card variation). Goal is to have the highest scoring hand according to the preset combinations called pedigree.

Rogue Angels is a character-driven solo or co-op Sci-Fi adventure for 1-4 players. The game blends engaging narrative with impactful choices leading to multiple paths through various missions and personal journeys.

Rogue Angels merges tactical combat with fluent turns and action management with asymmetric abilities, where you fight behavior-driven enemies through combined card and dice play.

The experience is much more than hack'n'slash, as Rogue Angels takes you through stealth missions, search and rescue, infiltration, evacuations, sabotage and much more. Many missions allow for flexible player approaches and adaptation.

Throughout your journey the decisions you make will permanently shape your character's personality and their relationship with other individuals, opening and closing possible paths along the way.

Rogue Angels offers individual difficulty settings allowing players an experience best suited for their level.

Set in the Burning Suns universe, you will be travelling a diverse galaxy and locations with various factions all vying for their way of life. You get the opportunity to become a hero, shield civilians from conflicts, defend your spaceship from boarding enemies, and help save the galaxy.

But be careful, as your team will be tested in numerous scenarios and face difficult choices in and outside of combat, and you will not be offered a second chance.

As a leader you must be willing to sacrifice everything and your legacy to bring peace to the many species of the Burning Suns.

—description from the designer

Reflecto is a word guessing game with mirrors.

Players move their pawns using the movement rule from Checkers.

To win the game, place your letters on the edge of play board to make your secret word. Or use your mirror to figure out opponent's letters and guess the secret word.

Trail Run is a push-your-luck game simulating long-distance running races on various terrain. Like in real life running events, players will have to pace themselves by deciding how many times they will roll the dice and thus try to run fast, but not too fast to avoid blowing up before they reach the finish line.

Players will roll the dice to move their pawns across the race course and the goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the Finish line which is the last space located on the Open Road terrain card.

On their turn player rolls 2 neutral dice: if different, player advances 1 step; if equal, 2 steps; if their sum is 7, player goes bust. In this last case the turn ends, otherwise the player may decide to roll again.

Before rolling the dice, player may announce they whish to use a water bottle to avoid going bust on the next roll.
There are 9 terrain cards and majority of them introduce some modifications to the game rules.

About a thousand years ago, somewhere in the world which is now called the middle east, two siblings started a new business: a delivery company called "Camel Express". But how could they convince people to use their services? And which of the two siblings should lead the company?
They found an answer to both questions: The most successful one will be the "Boss"!

In Camel Express!, two players compete against each other to prove who is the better businessperson and should be the boss. After the third new moon appeared, the player who manages to send the biggest Caravan on its journey is the winner of the game.

You can play this game in 3 different difficulties: Basic, Normal, and Advanced. We recommend starting with the Basic version and after just a few games and getting to know the rules, Play the Normal game. Do the same with the Normal game until you feel you are ready for some more challenges in the Advanced difficulty.

Players are dealt 6 cards to each player, then draw and place cards to build their caravan. During the action of drawing cards, if any player draws the New Moon card, the first round immediately ends. The game plays in 3 rounds. After the first round is over, start the second and then the third round exactly the same as the first round. After the third round is finished, the player with the highest total point is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.
In Far Cry: Escape from Rook Islands, a spinoff series based on Ubisoft's Far Cry universe, you head back to the 1980s for an explosive co-op tabletop adventure.

The sun is rising in the village of warrior cats, where everyone has just fallen asleep, exhausted after another festive dawn. Nobody dreams that the times of peace have their minutes numbered. The Mob of Rats begins the silent invasion, descending the sacred mountain thirsting for revenge.

Miau is a game of hand management and set collection for 1 to 4 players with a very little downtime. In a player turn, he/she should take a simple action: either buy a card or defeat a rat. You must defeat a rat using cats of same breed and using a unique power depending on cat used.

At the end of the game, who managed to use cat breeds efficiently and collect more points will be the winner of the village of warrior cats.

Who knew that landing on a potentially unstable yet exponentially profitable planet would’ve had consequences? Lo and behold, the predictable has happened and the planet has started to collapse. But fear not! The Planetary Development Corporation (PDC) has sent along a life pod with your expedition in case something bad happened. However, they’re not going to just let any old survivor of a cataclysmic event in! You have to prove your value to the PDC, and you do that by bringing back the rarest and most priceless artifacts from your expedition. If you can, it looks like a life of leisure and riches await. If you can’t, then you don’t have to worry about it for very long…

Welcome to Escape from a Dying Planet, a push your luck style card game where you and the other members of your doomed expedition fight to make it to the escape pod, grabbing as much treasure along the way and get off the planet! This game is a 2-8 player card game where players must try to overcome challenges and bid on treasures over the course of 10 turns. Be careful as you can gain contamination which will clog your deck and gain you negative points. Whomever has the highest value of treasures at the end wins!

You are an Arab merchant in the Middle Ages buying rolls of silk cloth in order to complete traditional projects. Completed project cards provide VIKTORY points, and the player with the most points wins the game!

The game takes a maximum of 20 minutes to play and ends after 20 rounds. There are no turns. Everyone plays simultaneously. New rounds are beeped by a timer and players draw up to three new cards and attempt to complete projects. For newer players or larger groups, rounds should be set to 1 minute. With experienced or fewer players, rounds should be set for less time, for example, 35 seconds.

Project cards requiring more resources and rarer resources are harder to complete, but provide significantly more VIKTORY points. Once each round, a player may discard his current project card and draw a new one.

If a player has the right combination of resource cards to complete a project card, he would:
1. Collect the needed resource cards and the project card
2. Turn them facedown in a completed project stack off to the side for end game scoring
3. Draw another project card from the shared deck of project cards

There are no trade restrictions. Players can trade any combination of resource, debt, or project cards as part of a trade.

Spartans & Successors is a simple set of wargame rules for the Golden Age of Greek and Macedonian history, enabling the great battles of antiquity to be played with limited numbers of figures in a small playing area.

Using a standard deck of playing cards per player and a gridded playing surface the rules offer a unique game play experience.
With elements of resource management and planning, bluff and the application of historical tactics players can refight the great battles of antiquity with limited figures - armies are the same size as a DBA army - on the kitchen table with minimal set up.

—description from the publisher

Faux-culte ! is a new card game to play while having a drink.  It contains 220 completely improbable audience (1 star) reviews of films so cult that you know them, even without having seen them!  But the whole game is there, will you recognize them ?!

Each player takes turns drawing a card and declaiming the comment aloud and with tone, as if it were their own. The first player to guess the title of the film targeted by the criticism wins the round.
Each player can give as many answers as they want, including while reading the commentary. If the title of the film is guessed before the end of the commentary, do not hesitate to reread the commentary completely so that everyone can enjoy it!

The player who guessed the title of the movie wins the card, which he keeps face down in front of him as a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dinosaur fans: Attention! In this game, a group of adventurous friends go out in search of dinos. Armed with fantasy and much joy, they immerse themselves in a world of colors.

Both dice are rolled and all players must look for the card that meets the conditions shown on the dice. Whoever finds the correct card first keeps it. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

The Middle Path is a board game about everyday Muslim problems. This hilarious, Party-style game, can be played by 2 to 4 players. Play up to 8 players by adding another deck of cards (which can be purchased separately).

Each player will take turns drawing cards from the deck. There are Attack cards, which move you away from the Middle Path, unless you have the correct defend card. Kind Deed cards will take you to the center of the board, unless and opponent ‘steals’ or ‘obstructs’ your kind deeds.

Although a fun party game, there is some strategy to it. Each card in the game simulates real-life problems that Muslims face on a daily basis.

There are 2 ways to win: First to reach the middle path or Last-Muslim-standing.

1 Deck = up to 4 players
2 Decks = up to 8 players
3 Decks = Sectarian violence

—description from the publisher

This game is really simple to play, even for players who don’t love word games at all. It's super easy to compose a word related to the theme: you can use all the letters you want, not only the ones in your hand, and creativity and puns are welcome! No frustration in sight!
Of course, you must try to find a word that grants you a higher score than your opponents’!

At the start of the game the Theme is revealed and you receive 8 Letter Cards:

    1 - Choose the Letter you like and pass the others to the player at your left
    2 - Repeat point 1 until there are no more cards to pass. Receive from the right, pick one, pass to the left. Easy, right?
    3 - Compose a word related to the Theme, using as many of your Letters as you can!


The player who finds the word with the highest value wins the current round and scores 1 point. When a player scores the third point, the game ends and that player wins the game. If 2 or more player find a word with the same value, they all score 1 point. If 2 or more players reach the third point in the same round, they share the victory (this happens rarely).

How good of an observer are you?

A game where finding the same patterns and objects will give you victory. With beautiful characters from the PUNA salteña.

Players must search among the cards in their hands and the cards available on the table, those that are combined correctly to be able to make groups of three. Whoever gets the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

The non-greatest heroes of the kingdom will face the evil villain in the fifth level of the chaotic dungeon. They will explore and find better, powerful (or useless) weapons, objects and equipment inside the five levels of the dungeon. However, the path to the darkness is full of danger, so they must collaborate with other adventurers knowing that, in the end, only one of them will rise with glory (and countless fortune).

Each turn, a player draw as many cards of the Heroic Action Dack as his hero can pick. Then, he can use as many of this cards in order to do any action (attack, explore, defend, move, etc.)

The game ends when the villain in the fifth level is killed.

The player with the most heroic points at the end of the game wins. A player can get heroic points by killing monsters, completing secondary missions or overcoming traps.

Become death and play as a new Reaper each turn,  trying to seize more souls than your fellow Reapers.

Players will each draw a new Reaper Card, Place 1-3 skull tokens on either the Reap, sweep and keep located on their reaper card, behind a small Screen. Reveal their cards and take turns Reaping (moving their Reaper Meeple around the board), Sweeping (removing the less desirable souls off the board) or Keeping (attempting to out bid other players for souls of the same type that their meeple is standing on)

The Player who successfully claims 9 souls by succesfully outbidding the others is the winner!

Quingo is a Roll and Write game that includes the box, 22 dice, 80 score sheets, and a rules document.

The goal of the game is to score the highest amount of points by the end of the game. Quingo takes place over a series of rounds, where players pull dice from a collective dice pool to record their scores. Each game, the bonus's vary for each category, changing your strategy per game. Also, each round in each game each player may be limited with the number of scoring combinations that are available, depending on their personal player die.

You must use strategy, luck, and your whits to outlast your opponents. Survive other players forcing you to take the dice that you don't want, or taking all the dice from the table, leaving you no options.
A word game, played from cards that have one letter each on them.

A brutal murder of a clergyman. Is the main suspect really guilty? You slip into the role of the investigator and, in this case, travel to San Giotto in Italy. Can you clear up this authentic sacred crime thriller?

Pez is a card game made up of 48 cards of 16 species of fish from our La Plata basin.

The complete deck represents the food chain of the river. The general idea of the game, with variations depending on the modality chosen, is to equal or exceed the numerical value of the card played by the immediately preceding player or by the opposing team (there are hand-to-hand modalities, individual up to 9 players and by teams in duos and trios). The player who plays the highest card takes the trick.

The winner or winning team is the one who manages to obtain more than half of the total possible points: there are 50 in total, as a reminder that the river is a living being and that the fish populations are not infinite.

Bring your family together for this easy to learn board game set in the magical world of burly Vikings and wild Dragons. Be the First Viking to climb the volcano to WIN!

Each Viking Teen travels along the game path by rolling the die, and advances the number of spaces. The space you land on will direct you to either twist the base of your pawn either 1 or 2 "clicks" or to spin the pawn. Each pawn has 2 sides: the Viking Teen indicates the front and their Dragon is the back. Whichever direction the Teen is facing when the spinning is done is the direction the player will move next turn (forward, backward, or along the main path). First player to land on the Winner space by an exact roll "flies" their dragon up to the Volcano's cloud to final victory and WINS!

Contents: 
1 Game board with magical spaces & 3D Volcano Walls 
4 Viking Teen Pawns and Spinning Bases (Teen on front, Dragon on back)
1 Die 
Full Instructions

Flights, England to Australia by air is a roll and move race game where players travel a path across the globe from Croydon in England to Darwin in Australia. Along the numbered path players encounter favourable or detrimental problems such as "take an extra turn" or "Return to Croydon for a new plane". The winner is the first to arrive in Darwin, Australia.

Published in Victoria, Australia, the playing map and aircraft path patriotically highlight the influence of British colonial rule during the late 20's and early 30's. Further to this it lists the pioneering aviators who made the journey during the early 20th century up to Amy Johnson in 1930.

After their boat was destroyed in a heavy storm, the players strand on a mysterious island. They have to solve various puzzles in order to leave again. But the island holds a secret, they didn't expect ...

Escape Adventures is played in two phases: First, the players have to piece together a two-sided, round puzzle. Than they begin to solve puzzles. Some of them require to turn the whole puzzle around, as some important information is only found on one of the sides.

A booklet contains the story of the game that develops as players solve more puzzles. To see if they solved the current puzzle correctly, players use special puzzle tiles to see if their solution forms a continuous line of a specific color.

The game aims to brimg the experience of an Escape Room to the home of the players. It can be played multiple times as no material gets destroyed while playing.

As the sun rises over the deserts, rivers, and oases of the Caliphate, a delicate balance has been upset. As one of many rival powers in the region, you now have the opportunity to alter the course of history and seize power for yourself. The ambitious Sultan sits in a golden palace, presiding over great works of architecture. The secretive Murshid works to covertly undermine the central authorities through an expansive network of agents.

The wandering tribes of the Nomad aim to sow discord in order to secure employment for their experienced mercenary citizenry. The ravaging forces of the Warlord sweep across the land, chasing after promises of plunder. And, in the face of chaos and uncertainty, the Caliph aims to preserve order through military might. Will you successfully navigate this web of rivalries and rise to prominence, or will you squabble with your lesser adversaries and fade into obscurity?

Crescent Moon is played over three years (or four years in the long game). Each year, players will take four actions which might be to deploy new armies, enlist mercenaries, build fortifications and settlements, conquer new land, expand their influence, and much more. Each character has a unique pool of abilities and available actions, which will shape their game, whether its the Sultan, who cannot raise their own army and must depend on mercenaries, or the Murshid, who can use their political influence to interfere in other characters' battles. Players can purchase potent power cards, representing ploys, wise advisors, and specialist units from a market shared between all players. At the end of each year, players score points according to their own unique character objectives, and at the end of the game, the player with most points wins.

Crescent Moon is an area control game for four or five players. Take on the role of one of five radically asymmetric characters, each with their own objectives to fulfil, unique actions to utilise, and game-changing special powers to employ. Build symbiotic relationships with your allies, undermine your rivals, and choose your friends and enemies wisely in this cut-throat game of power and politics.

In this game, you dive into the competitive/cut-throat/ruthless world of Startups and Beyond.

All too often, the startup world is celebrated for its victories and the challenges are glorified. While there is a lot to learn from successful startups, many lessons are discovered from those that fail too. Startups and Beyond will take you through the highs and the lows of this fantastic journey as a founder of a product company.

In Startups & Beyond, players are Founders of Product Companies and have to constantly plan and execute their strategies to build an economic engine that is resilient to any external forces which make the economic cycles unpredictable.

Players can choose from different categories of products that have different manufacturing costs and lead times. 
Players can choose to redesigned their products to give a better margin or add new products to diversify their risk of competition eating into their margins.

Players play the game simultaneously where they try to snag the best talent from the market to help with the product, marketing and sales strategies. Players also have to balance their spending, can raise funds from an investor or just take a bank loan based on their finances. As a founder, players can discover hacks and overcome roadblocks during the game. Every action has a cost attached to it and affects the end game scoring.

The game ends after playing 8 quarters (2 years).

The game includes worker placement, card drafting, economics and engine building mechanisms.

The players each take turns placing one of the 49 game pieces on a 7x7 playing field. The player who places a tile on the last square of a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row receives the victory points for this row according to its length (vertical and horizontal 7 each, diagonal 2 to 7). As soon as the last tile has been placed, the player with the most points wins.

The game has appeared in a series of games with educational intentions.

Be the fastest to find a word that meets all 3 conditions.

For lovers of word games, comes this super agile proposal to train mental skills and vocabulary. A game where participants play simultaneously, trying to be the first to say a word that complies the given conditions.

For an easier game or to play with children, you can play with two or one of the categories.

SETUP
Shuffle the 3 condition decks separatedly and reveal the top card from each one.

GAMEPLAY
Each round, players try simultaneously to say a word that complies with the 3 conditions. The first player to find that word, gains 1 point and take one of the 3 cards of their choice, and replace it with the top one of the correspondent deck. Then the next round begins.

The same word can't be used again during the next 3 rounds.
The same category can't be replaced twice in a row.

END OF GAME
The first player to reach 10 points, wins.

Each player chooses a color of macaron. Players take turns either drawing mini macarons from a bag or choosing one from their personal supply to place on the board. If once color dominates a 4 piece area the macarons grow to the next size. If an area is tied for color, the player placing the last macaron chooses which color will grow. The player that triggers the growth will also determines which color(s) return to the bag. The game ends when one player has placed their two largest macarons or no more macarons can be placed.

The players have the role of a republican agent during the Spanish civil war. Their objective is to buy arms in the black market or in the USSR to form new Battalions for the Popular Army. The behaviour of the battalions in combat and the achievement of our agent give us Victory Points. The game is divided in Battles and each battle has several turns.
There are 'Help' cards that are useful to manage your objectives or interfere with the other players activity.
 Each player receives several Action Points, Negotiation Points, Money and Two help cards at the start of each Battle.
The battle can be 4 or 5 turns long so during that turns the players have to move their agent through the board spending their Points and money in the different boxes of the board in order to get arms, conscripts and uniforms for assembling a battalion or to send weapons to the High Command (demanded in the Battle card). Doing this gives Victory Points. At the end of the last Battle Card the player with more Victory Points win the game.
 ---
Los jugadores tienen el rol de un agente republicano durante la Guerra Civil Española. Su objetivo es conseguir armas en el Mercado Negro o en la URSS con los recursos limitados que se tiene y con estas armas formar batallones que demanda la carta de batalla que está en juego. El comportamiento de estos batallones en combate y los logros de los agentes proporcionan Puntos de Victoria. El juego se divide en 'Batallas' y cada batalla tiene varios turnos. Hay cartas de 'Ayuda' que facilitan tus acciones y tambien molestan a los otros jugadores.
Cada jugador recibe varios Puntos de Acción, Puntos de Negociación, dinero y dos cartas de ayuda al comienzo de cada batalla.
La batalla puede durar 4 o 5 turnos, por lo que durante esos turnos los jugadores deben mover a su agente por el tablero gastando sus Puntos y dinero en las diferentes casillas del tablero para obtener armas, reclutas y uniformes para armar un batallón o para enviar armas al Alto Mando (exigido en la carta de Batalla). Hacer esto da Puntos de Victoria. Al final de la última carta de batalla, el jugador con más puntos de victoria gana el juego.

ConSEXuate is a game of affective Sex Education, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!

Arde ConSEXuate is a fun, adult game that challenges you to talk about sex.

The deck is placed face down in the center of the table. The most HOT player begins and from there to the left of him he will continue the round. The starting player picks up a card from the deck, reads it aloud and performs the action / command. If he complies with this card, it remains in his power, in the event that he does not comply, he will have to have a drink or make a garment that the group designates.

Who first manages to get to keep 5 cards wins.

With the help of wooden see-saws, you shoot colourful wooden dice into the ‘target box’. (The felt lining muffles any noise!)

Depending on the position inside the grid, the dice hitting the targets score points. Special rules also apply for skilled players; no matter how much chance intervenes, the more you play, the easier it becomes to score hits and the bar can be raised higher. The dice and see-saws can be packed into the solid and lockable wooden box to take away.

The games ends after all dice are thrown.
The player with the most points win. Points depend on the position of the dice in the Target box

Lay track, build train stations, and run trains. Keep all the train companies at a minimal stock market value to win. Be careful, if one company does too well, the others' stock values will drop.

At the end of 10 rounds, players must have managed 3 companies stock market values so that they are above a minimum value. The game implements an "equilibrium" mechanic, where one value going up might cause another value to go down.

-"Equilibrium": Keep values in equilibrium, rather than win by VPs or efficiency.

-"Suboptimal Assistants": Work cooperatively with an AI, however the AI does not always make the smartest decisions, so you will have to carefully choose when and where to take things over manually.

The game also comes with four maps to play and "Rails" a multi-map campaign. There is also an expansion that comes with more maps and game features.

This is a PNP submitted to the 2021 Solo PNP contest here on BGG.

The mysterious Egyptian sands hide many secrets, all of them lost to time. All of them, that is, except one! 

When your grandfather, Howard Carter, discovered the remains of the ancient pharaoh Tutankhamen, he believed there was another tomb connected to the first. A hidden tomb. A Lost Mummy. Now, many hard years and one fateful slip later, you find yourself trapped in that very tomb! Will you escape, or will you become just another lost memory buried under the sand?

The Lost Mummy is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a kids escape room experience. The game is designed to challenge 10 – 13 year-old children. It combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laid-back ease of group party games.

Players will work together to escape from an ancient Egyptian tomb before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of sequential puzzle sheets hidden around the room. Each puzzle solved progresses the story, and puts you one step closer to escaping the Lost Mummy’s tomb. Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then having them race against each other to see who escapes first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

Will you solve the mystery of the mummy’s tomb, before you’re trapped here forever?

You can’t imagine how naughty Grandpa Emmet’s sheep are! They have escaped from the pen and are hiding among the bushes. Will you be able to find them with the help of Grandpa Emmet?

Each turn, you roll the die, which will indicate the sheep you have to find and guide to your pen. The more sheep you find, the better! At the end of the game, the player that has the most sheeps behind the bushes is the winner.

The Lion and the Hunter is a game where one player is the lion and the other is the hunter. Players follow a route to the lions den. Along the way they must follow instructions as the come to them along the path. 
The winner is the one who reaches the lions den first. Alternatively if the hunter lands on the space occupied by the lion after space 60 he has captured the lion and the hunter wins the game. Prior to space 60 if either player lands on the other player then the player landed on goes back to the start.

The Smokey Game is an Australian community service board game for the prevention of forest fires. Players move by roll of a dice along a 60 space course that enters a Picnic ground and Koala sanctuary before continuing on to return to home on space 60.

Along the way certain green spaces promote good fire prevention practices and in turn help the player (i.e take a short cut). Red squares on the path highlight dangerous fire behaviour and this incurs a penalty to the player (i.e. Playing with matches go back to 26).

First player to complete the course is the winner.

Awkward is the ultimate test on finding out how well friends, couples, and family know each other!

In Awkward, on a players turn, they pick up a question card and choose between two options labelled A or B. They then place one of the voting cards (either A or B) facedown while everyone guesses which answer they chose and also place a voting card facedown. The answer is revealed and the players who guessed correctly are awarded with a Wick Point and the first to get 10, wins!

Climate change has major consequences for all of us. The polar ice caps are also melting.

In Volle Scholle, you have to pull your penguins across the melting ice to the finish line as quickly as possible. But watch out! If you risk too much, you'll swim.

Each player receives two game pieces (penguins). A player may roll the dice as many times as he wants. The numbers 3 to 6 each bring one movement point - if a player stops, he may distribute the movement points earned among his two penguins. On a 1 or 2, all points are lost and it is the next player's turn. After each round the ice melts, penguins standing on melted ice fall into the water and are out of the game. The winner is the player who gets the most penguins to the finish line, in case of a tie the fastest penguin.

The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)
